Title: De Novo Design of Bioactive Small Molecules by Artificial Intelligence
Tuning artificial intelligence on the de novo design of natural-product-inspired retinoid X receptor modulators
Most Potent Design: EC50 RXRβ = 15.7 ± 0.8 µM (59 ± 5 SEM) (N = at least 2 assay replicates)

Title: A Novel Scalarized Scaffold Hopping Algorithm with Graph-Based Variational Autoencoder for Discovery of JAK1 Inhibitors
Notes: The reference compound for scaffold hopping has an IC50 of 45 nM

Title: Combining generative artificial intelligence and on-chip synthesis for de novo drug design
Notes: Used "microfluidics platform for on-chip chemical synthesis"

Title: Beam Search for Automated Design and Scoring of Novel ROR Ligands with Machine Intelligence
Most Potent Design: IC50 LXRα = 0.37 ± 0.05 µM (N = at least 4 assay replicates)

Title: Discovery of Pyrazolo[3, 4-d]pyridazinone Derivatives as Selective DDR1 Inhibitors via Deep Learning Based Design
Notes: The generated set was virtually screened and 2 compounds with the highest docking scores were synthesized. The authors further performed SAR studies.

Title: Effective Reaction-Based De Novo Strategy for Kinase Targets: A Case Study on MERTK Inhibitors
Notes: RNN model generates building blocks compatible with selected reactions.

Title: Recurrent neural network (RNN) model accelerates the development of antibacterial metronidazole derivatives
Notes: 1 generated compound and 11 of its derivatives were synthesized. Within the 11 derivatives, 2 had IC50 < 10 μM. There were additional actives with a concrete potency measured > 10 μM.

Title: Target-Focused Library Design by Pocket-Applied Computer Vision and Fragment Deep Generative Linking
Notes: 2 rounds of generation. First round = 37 synthesized, second round = 6 synthesized. Second round takes the optimal inhibitor found from the first round and generates more linkers.

Title: AI-assisted de novo design approach to design a selective inhibitor for FLT-3(D835Y) in acute myeloid leukemia
Leveraging molecular structure and bioactivity with chemical language models for de novo drug design
Notes: 16 molecules (not the top scoring) were purchased from commercial suppliers resulting in a Kd = 640 nM hit. 2 top scoring compounds were manually synthesized and the most potent design had Kd = 63 nM. Derivatives of the top scoring generated compounds were also synthesized resulting in a compound with IC50 = 6.5 nM.

Title: Application of deep generative model for design of Pyrrolo[2,3-d] pyrimidine derivatives as new selective TANK binding kinase 1 (TBK1) inhibitors
Notes: 1 generated molecule was synthesized with IC50 = 66.7 nM. Further SAR studies resulted in more potent designs.

Title: Accelerated Discovery of Macrocyclic CDK2 Inhibitor QR-6401 by Generative Models and Structure-Based Drug Design
Outcome: nM inhibitor with in vivo validation
Notes: The hit rate is not completely accurate as the authors state some modifications were made on the generated structures for synthesis ease (it is unclear the extent of this). 13 compounds were initially synthesized. The crystal structure for one compound was solved and then a second generation campaign to generate linkers to form macrocycles was performed. The final optimal compound was validated in vivo.

Title: De Novo Design of Nurr1 Agonists via Fragment-Augmented Generative Deep Learning in Low-Data Regime
Notes: The model was fine-tuned with 1 known Nurr1 agonist which has an EC50 = 0.4 µM.

Title: Prospective de novo drug design with deep interactome learning
Most Potent Design: PPARγ EC50 = 1.5 ± 0.2 µM and PPARδ EC50 = 0.24 ± 0.05 µM
Notes: The model was fine-tuned with 1 known Nurr1 agonist which has an EC50 = 0.4 µM.
